intro: Dyschoriste keniensis subsp. glandulifera, commonly known as the Kenyan dyschoris, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its glandular features on its stems and leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually opposite and ovate in shape. The subspecies is notable for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
